isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - 12/06/1994 and After - OPERATION - HEATING

svcproc.title: HEATING
svcproc.para: For proper cold weather operation, the heat should be directed toward the floor. On vehicles with Blend-Air, turn the A/C off. Close the A/C registers to allow the maximum flow of heated air to be circulated at floor level.

Adjust the TEMPERATURE CONTROL knob as required to give the desired degree of heat. The full clockwise (red) position provides maximum heat. Move the AIR OUTLET knob to whichever position provides the desired air flow distribution between heat and defrost. For maximum air flow, move the fan switch to the HI position.
